meanings.definition: Latitudinarians: those who hold broad and tolerant views, especially in religious matters.
meanings.sent1: The latitudinarians in our community welcome people of all beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The latitudinarians at the church embrace diversity and understanding.
meanings.sent3: The latitudinarians at the potluck made sure there were options for everyone's dietary needs.
meanings.sent4: She was a true latitudinarian, accepting all perspectives with an open heart.
meanings.sent5: The latitudinarians' motto was 'unity in diversity'.

meanings.definition: Latitudinarians: characterized by tolerance or broad-mindedness.
meanings.sent1: Her latitudinarian approach to parenting allowed her children to explore their interests freely.
meanings.sent2: The latitudinarian professor encouraged students to think critically and express their opinions.
meanings.sent3: The latitudinarian policy of the company fostered a positive and inclusive work environment.
meanings.sent4: His latitudinarian attitude towards change made him a flexible and adaptable leader.
meanings.sent5: The latitudinarian perspective sees value in different viewpoints.
